content.description:
This awesome pitch follows the obvious hanging crack system, located 20' climbers' left of

Lunch Box Special

. Begin with a short face section (25'), and use an incipient crack (1"-3" gear) and single bolt for protection (5.10+). Gain small ledge below

LBS

crack, and climb this crack through small, left-facing roof/corner for 25' (5.10-). Traverse left at the second protection bolt and enter the Superette crack (5.10-). Follow this radness for 60', and look for locker fingers (3/4"-1" gear, 5.11) with an easing hand section above (2"-3" gear, 5.9/.10-).

The upper finger crack protects mainly with 1" Friends, red Aliens or 0.5 Camalots. Despite this bigger finger size, the crack is locker fingers because of how it's offset or tilted and a few good rests make it easier 5.11. This is a MUST DO!
content.protection:
2 - 1/2"

2 - 3/4"

3 - 1"

1 - 1.5"

1 - 2"

3 - 3"

2 - 3.5"

2 bolts.

Bring several quickdraws and long one or two. There is a two bolt anchor.

See first ascent rack, and bring supplements if you like.

The rack for Superette minus QDs.
content.location:
This route and several others are located directly above the access trail. It is located 25 feet left of the beginning of

Lunch Box Special

,

Groove Tube

, and

A Walking Enigma

. Look for short hand crack (1-3") below a single bolt. This variation ends up joining

LBS

for 25' but is well in line with the upper crack system. The line is clean and direct with no rope drag, as long as you protect it wisely.

content.description: Climb a short splitter and corner (.9+) with finger jams before heading left up a larger, arching, finger hand crack (.10a). A large, loose block halfway up freaked out the FA party, but if trundled, this could become a great route!
content.location: It is 700 feet climber's right of the Retro Groove Wall.

climbs.name: Rope Master's Crack
climbs.fa: Rob Peterka and Greg McCain, April 1998

content.description: Climb hands to OW in obvious, widening crack.
content.protection: Cams 2.5"-6" with a 2 bolt anchor up top. Watch your ropes when you pull 'em...hence the name. There is a fixed and cut rope we found on our 2nd ascent.
content.location:
This is in the center of Red Rocks Simulator Wall, just right of

Air Time

, sharing its anchor.

content.description:
Climb this splitter crack past 2 bolts through bulge until seem widens (5.12+ or AO), then the crack quickly widens through short OW and fun hand/fist jams until it narrows again for awesome finger crack finish(5.10+).

A free ascent requires throws to grim crimps down low but locker jams and foot holds await up top:)
content.location:
This route begins 40 feet left or up canyon from "

Air Time

" on an exposed ledge with stable belay stance. There is a 2 bolt anchor up top.

climbs.name: Redemption Arete
climbs.fa: I. Altman, C. Brenon, K. Alinger, 1999

content.description: Climb the right side of a large block by doing short and well protected layback move (5.7). After surmounting block, leave a small ledge and climb arete past 5 bolts (5.7-). There is great exposure if you stay left and on the arete.
content.protection: Gear: one 3.5" (#3 Camalot) is needed for the start, then 5 QDs to the 2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location:
This route is just left of the "

Beehive Buttress

" and right of "

Arm and Hammer

" and the Red Rocks Simulator Wall.

content.description:
Climb a short corner (the same as

Groove Tube

and

A Walking Enigma

) 5.9 to gain a left-facing corner to high ledge (5.10). It has fun jammin' and stemming up top.
content.protection: Gear: 1/2" or wires down low and 2"-3.5" up top.

content.description:
Begin just right of "

Rope Master's Crack

," and follow bolts until crack widens enough for gear (5.8). You can step left to the anchor for "

Air Time

" and the "

RMC

" or follow crack over subtle bulge (5.9+), placing small wires and micro cams. The crack then widens, and good stemming makes it a lot easier to the top (5.9).
content.protection:
6 bolts.

1 or 2 small wires (#4 stopper or equivalent brassie)

1-1/3"

1-3/8"

2-1/2"

2-3/4"

1-1"

1-1.5"

1-2"

1-3"
content.location: Begin in the center of Red Rock Simulator Wall and right of the obvious OW on the line that clearing heads to the top of the buttress. There are 2 bolts anchor up top.

climbs.name: The Groove Tube
climbs.fa: I. Altman, J. Kelly, & B. Keyes, 1997

content.description: Climb a short, right-facing corner (5.9), gain a ledge, and then follow an awesome, shallow corner or groove (5.10) to near the top of the wall before traversing right (5.9) to hand and finger crack which leads to anchor.
content.protection: Gear: 1/2"-3" extra 1/2"-1",  small to medium wires, 3 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is located right at the top of the newer and improved "Pump House" approach trail.

content.description: Climb a right-facing corner (5.10) past blocks and small ledge before it joins another wider, arching corner (5.10+). Fist jams and wide hands bring you to a high ledge and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This route is located about 1000' climber's right of the "

Groove Tube

" and the Retro Groove Wall.

content.description:
Start 10 feet right of

A Walking Enigma

, and follow a short corner to flake (5.9/10). Follow bolts up and right into short crack(5.9, 1/2"-2/3" inch). Do rad, footless mantels on center of arete (5.11-) before joining last four bolts and the final crack of

A Walking Enigma

(5.10+). This is super fun and a foot burn by the end!
content.protection: 11 bolts plus gear from 1/2"-2" for short lower crack and 30' top crack.
content.location: This route begins at the top of the approach trail.

content.description: Climb the slab under the archway and roof via edges, crimps, and slopers past 6 bolts.
content.protection:
6 QDs.

Per

eli poss

: bring a double length sling/cordelette to equalize the anchor.
content.location:
This route is just right of Red Rocks Simulator Wall and the "

Redemption Arete

" under a large, obvious, and very cool archway. There is a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Climb varnished edges and pockets past 11 bolts and a few runouts. The cruxes are near bolts 2, 4 and 9.
content.location: This climb begins on the far right side of the Red Rocks Simulator Wall. There's a 2 bolt anchor up top.

content.description: Follow cross-bedding and a mosaic of desert varnished face holds up the less than vertical face to the top of 90' foot pillar. The first ascent party followed hand crack to the left before hopping on the face and drilling on lead. Rookie hooking lead to big whippers and the name :) 2 additional bolts were later added to the bottom. The technical crux is at the bottom (first 10') with a fun mental crux at the top. Good times all around!

Climb

Groove Tube

for 30 feet before moving right onto face holds. Clip 8 bolts and join hand/finger crack  to anchor. The crux is on the face on deceivingly sloping holds and high-step edges.
content.location:
This route is located at the top of Pump House Approach Trail, just right of the

Groove Tube

.
